posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Gnomes are odd characters and its time to try to make one


Here was a fun build idea I came up with:

- Dev crit

- Scimitar for maximal critical threat potential

- Small stature to wield a scimitar in two hands for maximal strength damage and +1 AB/AC against all enemies

- 4 attacks per round

- Blind fight and knockdown

- Bard for its song, tumble and spellcraft for maximal skill dumps and some spell casting 

- UMD to cast any spell in the game

- Blackguard for its glorious weapon/armor proficiencies, not needing a weapon focus as a pre-requisite, bonus to saves, divine might (for just a sprinkle of divine damage when desired), 5d6 sneak attack, use poison, undispellable stackable bull's strength, delightful bonus feats and summon Vrock to take some damage

- Pale Master for free undead summons, +10 AC, crit/sneak immunity, stun/paralysis immunity, and the amazing Epic Warding and Epic Mage Armor spells as bonus feats

- Maximum taunt skill to further lower enemies AC so you can deal some nice damage to them

- No exp penalties


I found one build used this exact class combo  and amounts (B5BG16PM19) but went full charisma! had a strength of 14 and had like an AB of 30 (it wasn't described was from 2004) or something like that (http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 37093.html) its certainly not a build I would want to play


Anyway I got this guys base AB to 40 then with taunt you can 'add +6 AB' and with the bard song +1 AB, so its kinda more like 47 AB in practice? 

Maybe? I havent made a proper taunt build yet :) You guys will know better than me

Thought this guy might be fun to play :)

Good learning experience for me too. Haven't made a proper gnome + taunt + epic mage armor build yet who can summon both demons and undead

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Numbers are good for someone with 25 non-warrior lvls.
Little-guy seem like fun to play, but, I'm worried a little because of the huge gap between the 4th & 5th bard lvl.
Also, EMA is more useful than EW, take that first, so you can freely customize your gear.
Try to make a bard(8)/ blackguard(16)/ pale-master(16), version of it & see what gives.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Bard 8 Blackguard 16 Pale Master 16 version

Had to drop knockdown but still managed to fit EMA and EW into the build

If I made this guy a human I wouldn't have this problem (grrrrr) :)

and get an extra 43 skill points...

... it must be a rare build that human is not the optimal choice (aside from arcane archers, dwarven defenders, and some fighters)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Ninja'd by both Valerfor and Orion
My thoughts were along the same lines:

This class combo is "Bad to the Bone".  PM adds a lot of defensive qualities to the build. BG adds 10 pre epic levels of full BAB progression, sneak attack, better saves, stackable Bull's, summons etc. If you want to roleplay something evil from beyond the grave, you have the avatatar here. Bard serves as a stepping stone to qualify for the prestige classes and for a late skill dump.
If you are going to play this on WoG, I guess all the AC will serve you well.
The AB of +40 is a bit on the low side for a warrior build. It is a slow starter taking a heavy hit to BAB early on with only BAB +4 at level 8. But after that it gets better with full BAB progression. You also have Bard song, stacking Bull's and Taunt to help you with hitting. Bard also has full access to scrolls via UMD; if you can read them, you can use them with no further check, even on hardcore and harder difficulties.
All in all a fun build once you get it off the ground.

Spoiler I see some tweaks you can try if you want: If you drop KD you have room for Great cleave pre epic. Taking a Great strength at lvl 24 leaves an open slot on a general feat later on. Now what to do with it? You could take KD that you dropped in the first place, you could take the epic vrock or you could take EMA. The last alternative let you build with only 16 PM levels. The AC will be the same. The undead summon will be different. Those 3 levels open up for Bard 8 with a better song, more spells available and more frequent skill dumps.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for the feedback Mick, I feel better about dropping knockdown

Yes I am not looking forward to leveling this hero pre level 15...

And great suggestion for Bard 8 from both you and Valerfor ->> gives +1AB to the song and a whole bunch of skill dumps

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Ok hmmm

I've swapped gnome for human. +1 feat +43 skill points which I put into discipline

I've dropped Bard 8 for Bard 5 / BG 19 / PM 16. 
Gives me an extra bonus feat and I'm totally a sucker for that. Skill dumps particular tumble and UMD will have to be spaced out

Scimitar and shield (for +8AC with a +5 tower, I don't think the extra bonus damage from two handed is worth +8AC - thats like 40% reduced chance to hit if your AC is in range of the enemy's AB) will help manage the spaced out tumble skill dump. 

Got the strength up to 32 by reducing Charisma, I'm sure it can be buffed with eagles splendor scrolls / potions or +cha items for extra saves and to help put the Cons to 14

He's got EMA and an undispellable bull's strength that lasts 19 hours so he should be able to make space for a +cha item or two... plus I think Arbas has a shield which casts Greater Eagles Splendor which might be handy...

Dropped divine might (not sure how useful its going to be really even if I buff it up - if he was a dual wielder maybe I would think differently) to allow me to get improved knockdown. Knock em down then 6d6 sneak attack them + crit them. Sounds good to me.
Also I think WoG has an amulet that allows me to use that ability anyway but I just dont get a good feeling about it
Maybe others will comment on it

What do you think now? Not quite the AB of an Andariel but is getting close ish

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:Edit: by the way - I heard whispers the Tyrantfog Zombie summon obtained through Pale Master is handy for early levelling
It's really good because it has DR of 15/+1, and it can be buffed with Flame Weapon, Bulls, Barkskin etc.  
You can even try and get Animate Dead scrolls prior to level 5 for earlier carnage.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Looks sharp Orion, for better playability you could also put that last bard lvl at 37th & have two explosive levels (36th & 37th) that will push you to forty with ease.
